name: Crolinnhe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After searching around Fortwilliam and finding many very very poor hotels, b&b's with tiny rooms we decided to return to the Crolinnhe for the second time. A nice 10 minute walk to the town centre.
reviews.title: First Class
Okay, but.....
reviews.text: This is a wonderful place to stay and worth every penny as it is fairly expensive. Flora looks after you very well indeed! We stayed in Cro Mhor a very nice double room with large bath, shower and everything else of a high standard. Good breakfast served in the morning too!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you do have to stay in Fortwilliam do yourself a favour and save an hour of searching by booking into the Crolinnhe.
reviews.title: A Great Place To Stay

likes.liked: — The size, style and finishing of the room

reviews.text: It is spotless, immaculate, helpful host and beautiful location but...maybe we are fussy but the decor reminded me of my mother's decor - boring, utterly tasteless, prissy what more should one say. And it isn't just taste, it is by no means cheap so why should one feel they have to be on their best behaviour or be ready fo rbreakfast when the host says we have to be ready? I know it is a B and B and hence someone's home but we are paying good money for the privilege - your choice? Why exactly have beige/white carpets in the bathrooms? Why do we have to order breakfast the night before - who knows how we will feel in the morning. With only 4 rooms is this really necessary?
reviews.title: It doesn't get any better

likes.liked: — Quality of everything and friendly owner

reviews.text: I am sorry but the B and B industry in Scotland need to wake up - big time.
reviews.title: five stars aren't enough

reviews.text: Crolinnhe is an oasis of good taste and good service in this otherwise grim town. Flora made us feel very welcome, the B&B is small so excellent personal service is assured. Great location with views over Loch Linnhe, nice furnishings and an excellent breakfast !
reviews.title: Beautiful Place
This is a great place!
reviews.text: Flora MacKenzie has created a wonderful, warm and very beautiful home away from home in Crolinnhe. We have stayed with Flora twice, and both times it was a highlight of our trip. She welcomes the visitor, and you immediately feel very much at home. Breakfast is great, and served with a flourish. Flora can give advice on dinner in town and walks nearby.

description: Our 5 star Bed & Breakfast in Fort William, in the Highlands of Scotland, is set within extensive private grounds. This Victorian villa enjoys uninterrupted views over Loch linnhe. Crolinnhe offers luxury bed and breakfast facilities with a warm and friendly atmosphere.
